text:
Don't blame China for the loss of jobs in America, there was a deliberate corporate strategy  many years ago to outsource American manufacturing jobs to China, what country would not welcome that type of investment, auto companies, electronic and furniture manufacturers left America over 20 years ago for China attracted by cheap wages and China's lack of unions or worker protections. It's the multinational companies motivated by greed that caused the huge imbalance in trade with China. Blaming China deliberately lets these anti-American greedy CEOs off the hook , they took home billions in wages and bonuses at the expense of the steel , furniture, textile, auto workers across the United States.
Where was Trump or Bannon when millions of Americans were losing their jobs due to these corporate decisions, the social contract between worker and employer has been broken for a long time , Trump has acted as a relief valve for millions of frustrated American workers and their families but if he doesn't do what he promised, bring home the jobs and stop draining the treasury paying for endless and needless wars but instead spend the tax dollars on infrastructure, schools and healthcare then you will see massive civil strife across the country and no amount of blame deflecting will convince the public that no one but the plutocrats running the country for their own gain are to blame for America's most unfortunate demise.

text:
It seems the farmers of The United States have changed drastically.  The farmers of The United States used to be very industrious, export and marketing oriented.  The United States farmers used to be very spread horizontally and vertically throughout the world.  The pioneers of Arizona used to advice us that we shouldn't 'Put our Eggs in one Basket', especially when The United States was the pioneer number 1 in Agriculture, farming and export.

Consequently, the current United States farming communities need to adjust, diversify, look, network and tie up their export businesses with other nations, like Africa, Middle East, North Africa, South America and Europe, instead of always focusing on Asia, especially closed and one sided China and the likes who have very different value systems, dynamics, policies, have become dependent on technological and economic free rides and above all, they are very protective, nationalistic, dishonest and having different closed Socio-Communist cultures, commune systems.

They believe and used only in winning/gaining and ripping off others, because they have become totally dependent on foreign markets, technologies, research outcomes, innovations and so on.  They don't believe in fairness, role of law, transparency and human rights.  They are secretive and clandestine in their behaviours, practices and preaches.

In conclusion, it is suggested that The United States Farming Communities change, expand and spread their networks with other markets to free themselves from the risks of becoming hostages dependent on none stable black markets ending up blackmailed in times of need and in difficult times.  'NEVER EVER PUT YOUR ENTIRE EGGS IN ONE BASKET ENDING UP EASY BREY IN RUTHLESS HANDS'.
author: John A LINCOLN

text:
Recently, Steve Bannon has finally brushed up the sense of existence. The former US president's senior strategic adviser, who once known as the "White House Master", has been sighing and screaming around in August 2017, screaming at his sleazy Chinese clichés and trying to make a comeback. Now, when the US government once again lifted the tariff bar on China, Bannon seems to feel the opportunity to come. He took the opportunity to concoct a long article and confessed from six aspects that "China has become the biggest enemy of the United States." In this "economic war" with China, we must compromise with the tariffs.

A closer look at the so-called six aspects of evidence supported by Bannong can be described as logical confusion and ridiculous conclusions. It is simply unbearable, and it feels that he has become mad and suffering from snoring.

For example, Bannon accused China of having been engaged in “economic warfare” with industrial democracies. The fact is that China’s “One Belt, One Road” initiative has built the world’s largest platform for sharing, sharing and sharing, and has become the world’s most popular public product. . For another example, he claimed that the US-China trade dispute is a "fundamental conflict". The United States insists on tariffs, is full of extreme militant thinking, ignores the historical lessons of "the trade war has no winners," and violates global public opinion. In addition, he attacked China's "theft" and "plundering", and it was unfounded and unfounded. Because in 2017, China's domestic patents, trademarks, industrial designs and other types of intellectual property applications ranked first in the world. In 2018, China's innovation index ranked among the top 20 in the world, ranking 17th, up from last year. 5 digits. China has become one of the world's largest intellectual property owners. How come "stolen"?

Bannon’s most hostile remarks are that he slanders China’s desire to become a “global hegemon” and reflects its deep-rooted hegemonic thinking. At the Asian Civilization Dialogue Conference, which opened on Wednesday (15th), Chinese President Xi Jinping pointed out in his keynote speech that "friends and good neighbors and peace and harmony are the consistent way of life of Chinese civilization." President Xi has repeatedly Public announcements at home and abroad firmly stated that no matter which step is taken, China will never seek hegemony and never expand, and will never impose the tragic experience that it has experienced on other nations. The concept of "community of human destiny" put forward by President Xi Jinping is to express China's joint development with all countries, common security, governance, joint participation, and shared results. This feeling and responsibility of "taking the world as the public" is difficult or deliberately unwilling for American politicians who pursue "American priority", only my own respect, narrow and selfish.

(Infographic: Steve Bannon Photo credit: China News Service) (Infographic: Steve Bannon Photo credit: China News Service)
In the face of the facts, Bannon’s confusing lie is like a broken soap bubble, which is surprising but only a ridiculous and generous. However, some of the far-right politicians in the United States, represented by Bannong, have fallen into the filth of China, but they have the potential to return to the ghost of "McCarthyism" in the 1950s. The American politicians who promoted the alternative right-wing movement are self-satisfied, threatening the core decision-making level, pursuing xenophobia, shaping China into a scapegoat, and arguing the normal economic and trade friction between the United States and China into an irreconcilable conflict of values ​​and civilization. I even want to have a war between the United States and China immediately to satisfy their lust and ambition to gain more space for political activities.

It is noted that just this Wednesday (15th), some US senators announced that they have submitted a bill to Congress to prohibit the issuance of visas to the United States for personnel working or sponsored by Chinese military research institutions to reduce the so-called "US security risks." On the same day, the White House also announced that the country has entered a "state of emergency", prohibiting US companies from using telecommunications equipment produced by companies that pose a danger to national security. It is widely believed that the intention of this move is that Huawei’s intention is very obvious.

In today's economic globalization, the United States, the world's most developed country with super-scientific technology, military and economic strength, is so savage, and the sense of security is so bad that it is really unbelievable to shut the door to the world. Fighting against the enemy is easy, except for the heart. In fact, the only thing that can defeat the United States is itself. Right now, the new right wing that jumps in the United States, holds the "zero-sum" game and the old thinking of power politics is the real enemy of the United States. The American people should be vigilant about this new "McCarthyism" represented by Bannon.


President Xi Jinping once vividly said that protectionism is like turning himself into a dark room. It seems to have escaped the wind and rain, but it also isolates the sun and the air. Right now, what makes the world feel sad is that under the clamour and shackles of the "bannons," the United States is closing the black house more and more tightly, waiting for it or will be self-suffocating.

text: Enterprises entering China is another aspect 8:11 that Bannon got it wrong. Business entry will increase the surplus (of China), because goods are produced from China and then sold to the United States, or because of the sale locally, it will reduce imports (from the United States). Companies like Apple, produced in China, sold to the United States, counted as China's surplus. If you only want to reduce the surplus, you should limit companies like Apple to enter China. Ford also has several manufacturing plants in China. If Chinese people buy Ford cars in China, they will not buy Ford cars imported from the United States. This is not good for reducing the surplus. Of course, it is undisputed that companies like Apple Ford entering China helped China increase employment. In this Sino-US trade negotiation, the United States hopes that China will liberalize restrictions on entering the Chinese production market. For example, the proportion of shares should be liberalized, and the market cannot change technology. If this aspect is put more open, the future trade surplus will be even bigger. Many years later, it will have to continually quarrel for the surplus. I don't know how Chinese and American negotiators (and Mr. Nannon) think about it.

text:
I would enjoy countries, especially Western countries to adopt a mirror foreign policy. What the means in essence is how one country is treated with foreign investment MUST reflect the same with the other.
Example. 
No foreigners individual or company is allowed to purchase real estate assists in mainland China. Therefore no individual or company is allowed to purchase real estate in Australia.
In China all incoming companies must pair with a local manufacturer. Therefore all Chinese state owned foreign assets must pair up with a local manufacturer.
Same with mining
Same with stock
Same with everything it is a reflection/mirror.
Doing this encourages co operation and transparency and shuts out selfish nations who don't play by the free market rules.
Also the Chinese cannot say that the world is treating them unfairly, because it is just a reflection of there own foreign policy;

If you like this idea, spread the thought, with enough traction it may manifest sooner that you think.
All countries should adopt a mirror foreign policy immediately

text:
Formal complaint against Tung Wah hospital F2 ward and Happy Valley police 
June 26, 2018
It is purely due to negligence on the part of the Tung Wah hospital that my mother was indirectly murdered by Tung Wah hospital F2 ward !!!   My mother had been feeling unwell for 3 days and on Saturday night - June 9, 2018 she was really in bad shape !!!   

According to my brother, my mother had problem breathing on Thursday, June 7.  When I saw my mother evening of June 8, she did not look good and her mouth was watering a bit, she was given a square lump of rice which she said she could not eat, but one woman talked like as if she was in the market and said the language therapist prescribed she could only eat this !!!  We had to cook our own food or buy something she could eat !!!    After insisting, she finally gave her a bowl of oatmeal but came back a few minutes later saying this is forbidden and wanted to take back the bowl of oatmeal !!!  After such unnecessary harrassment my poor mother simply could not have any appetite any more !!!   When the time for visiting expired, I went to the counter and asked to see Dr Cheng.  The nurse who spent almost an hour demanding me to leave the F2 ward about a week ago said I must state reason for seeing the doctor.  I told her Dr. Cheng made appointment to want to see me but she did not turn up, since my mother's conditions were bad, I wanted to follow up with her.  The nurse repeated three times if necessary, the doctor would contact me.  I reinterated Dr. Cheng made appointment but she did not turn up and since my mother was not feeling well, I would like to contact her and talk to her.  At last the nasty nurse said she would make a note !!!  

When I stepped into the room on Saturday, June 9, I was shocked to see my mother's seating posture although I could not see her face -  the impression I got was she was in bad shape.  When I walked close to her bed, I felt extremely sad because she did not seem to have any energy, her bibs were dirty but she could not eat or drink at all !!!  I noticed her already very thin face shrunk even further, it looked as if her skin was stuck to her bones only, the little flesh on her face seemed to have disappeared compared with the day before, her forehead was wrinkled in pain, she could not sit still and was shifting from left to right feeling very uncomfortable !!!  

I could not help bursting into tears and went to the counter, I repeatedly told the nurses in tears and asked to see the doctor, three of them sat close together and were doing nothing but just chatting.  Without even checking, they still said nothing was wrong and my mother was better off than many others in the room.  They said a lot of patients could not even eat by themselves but my mother could sit and eat by herself !!!  Meantime my youngest brother came and I pointed out to him the symtoms I noticed on my mother's face.  After coming back from the washroom, the three of them disappeared already and later my brother told me one nurse drove them away simply because she said they were causing inconvenience by standing round my mother, although visiting time had not expired  !!!   F2 ward is the only room with 2 hours, while the normal visit hours are 3 for all other wards !!!   Around 8:30pm I asked to stay a bit longer and was "granted" another half an hour !!!   


I could not sleep the whole night because I was so worried and at around 5:30am on June 10 I called my mother's mobile and there was no answer !!!  At 5:42am a woman from Tung Wah called asking us to rush to the hospital as my mother's heart beat was dropping !!!   When I arrived at Tung Wah F2 ward my mother was indirectly murdered already !!!  None of us could see my mother off !!!   I was furious and demanded a thorough investigation !!!    After my mother was taken away from F2 ward I went back to ask for an appointment to see the doctor, it is unbelievable that the nurse sitting at the counter replied in a very cold and indiffernt tone even after my mother was indirectly murdered by them !!!   I was informed later the appointment with Dr. Cheng was at 1pm on June 11 at F2 ward !  


There was a female head of nurse by surname Chan with Dr. Cheng.  Dr. Cheng said she was surprised to hear my mother gone because my mother was supposed to have recovered and should leave that place a few days later !!!   When Dr. Cheng started talking about the medical issues I immediately interrupted by telling her my observations during the last couple of days and it is ONLY common sense that my mother was obviously and definitely indirectly murdered due to pure negligence for three days !!!  When asked when they discovered my mother was in danger, Dr. Cheng said around 12:30 am on June 10, and someone called us around 1:00 am "according to the report" she had on hand.  We told Dr. Cheng none of us received any call from F2 ward !!!  The first call was 5:42am !   When asked exactly when my mother had her last breath, Dr. Cheng said around 6:40 am, but my second brother immediately said he rushed to F2 ward in a taxi and arrived prior to that time but my mother was already gone !!!  I cannot believe such important and crucial points in the "report" Dr. Cheng was reading can be WRONG  !!!   What else in the so-called "report" can we take seriously !!!

text: Hopefully we can start to bring back some development to the west too. It would be great to see our cities start to grow and bristle with new sky-scrapers once again and for young people to really feel like they have the possibility to move to some of our cities, which seem to increasingly only be open to the super-wealthy. We are, currently, in a very good position in the west but with every passing year our position weakens and we will soon reach a crossing point where, if we don't act, there will be no return and we will fall so far behind China and Asia that we will be consigned to the history books as once great nations. I want to see the whole world prosper, including China, but that prosperity should not be at our own expense. This is not a zero-sum game. We have a lot of strengths in the west and we need to start using those to our advantage and start a new process of rapid technological development and progress. We need massive deregulation to allow for this rapid development and we also need to change some of our laws to allow for new industries to grow and flourish, such as scrapping drug laws which would end so many social problems associated with organised crime, save billions from the failed war on drugs and also generate billions in revenue and taxes which would otherwise line the pockets of cartels and terrorist groups. We need to regain peoples confidence in the system of free-market capitalism and so long as the war on drugs continues I think we will be unable to convince people that we are on the right path as it stands as a huge contradiction and actually undermines everything politicians say about freedom. There would also be many billions to be made by companies in this new industry and many people could become extremely wealthy as a result.

In the US years ago, we had American companies. In competition

in America. Places like Walmart starting to open selling these Chinese like
goods like Timex watch rather than a good old well-made swiss like products.





Then the Unions took hold and starting demanding higher and
higher wage for their members to the point where the American companies couldn’t
compete. So these companies started moving out of the America to use this low
labor offered in other countries. This is where were at now.





Its no use doing anything at this time until we can controll
the unions and always pay a fair wage.





So what’s going to happen Trump is starting this trade war

picture when these companies relocate back to the US. It will create a lot more

text: There are dozens of countries surrounding China that can replace ALL of China's exports in only 12 to 18 month's time from now.  With these new 25% tariffs on EVERYTHING coming from China, all of the companies that import stuff into America will be re-aligning their supply chains to bring in stuff from these other countries instead of China. The imports will be only 5% to 8% more expensive than those that came from China, much less than paying the 25% tariffs.  At that point, China is going to hurting big-time. They will have lost their biggest trading customer and a customer that large is not easy to replace unless you somehow create another 'American' out there in the world.  America will suffer only a little bit as imports from China are only 15% of America's imports.  So 15% of a 6% rise in import prices is only a rise in import costs of 0.9%  (less than 1%), which will be almost unnoticeable by the average American consumer.

text:
Yes indeed, the 2016 American election did not go as planned and expected by several groups. 
From a German perspective, I have been amused by how Mr. Trump has been portrayed by the media over here, and in fact our department of foreign affairs has favored and donated to Hillary Clinton, and our former secretary of state (current representative President of state) has even been so foolish to call Trump (while he was still campaigning) a "preacher of hatred", imagine that. I wonder how much more bovine a high ranking representative of a state that is supposed to be a friend and an ally can get, with regard to a candidate of a democratic presidential race of a nation that has brought democracy to this/our nation in the very first place. To say that that was foolish is quite an understatement. 
Mr. Trump has been falsely portrayed and mischaracterized beyond belief, a sexist, a misogynist, a homophobe a racist, a would-be dictator an authoritarian/autocrat, you name it, nothing was spared and no slander was left out with regard to his person. 
At times it really made me wonder, how he could possibly want to get himself into that all, when he did not have to, and how he could possibly withstand all that, very impressive that he has, and what he has been able to accomplish. 
He proved so many people wrong and made them look foolish by now. 
There is a method to his ways, and whenever he seems to appear erratic and imprudent, that is when somebody is being set up. 
I've always said, those that call his actions "clueless, simpleminded and dumb" are very likely the ones that are in fact actually the clueless, simpleminded and dumb.

text: I get that if you view economics and trade as a game. No emotion, everybody operating on self interest no decision grounded in sentiment. It isn't whether Trump is decent, it's whether he can engineer a win from this..  The idea that China become a 'Decent Global Economic citizen' US deals aren't fair, they're disproportionate in favour of the US because of their leverage, we all know this in smaller countries and we all accept it as the nature of unequal competition. So China is doing the same, so can he win is the question. Really this is a play to make China submit and presumably accept less, because the US are making the proposition that the trade legislation as it stands isn't fair.. So will they submit? With their moves in strategy, you can say 'lashing out' but more than lashing out, it implies philosophically that they aren't accepting the idea. It's interesting I guess.

text:
"Buy Canadian".    We here it all the time in this country.....but try.    The stores are filled with products from China.   Our factories are closing but the companies that own them still exist.   They're just not operating here anymore except to sell their cheaper products.    I worked for one of the biggest shoe manufacturers in the world,  a Canadian company, and they no longer make shoes here.   Their factory is now being renovated into a retirement home.   They're still huge in 3rd world countries, though but their corporate structure is so that you don't know what products are theirs and which isn't.

Who did this "free trade" benefit?   It definitely wasn't the blue collar workers and the middle class.   It was the corporate leaders,  the big investors who opened factories in 3rd world countries to take advantage of cheap labour and then sell those products here and strangle out the local small companies.   

Incredibly,  those people who say that they support socialism and the left aren't really helping the working class at all.    They're supporting the elites.   Trump is right.   MAGA is just a slogan,  hyperbole that describes a greater idea.   The idea that the ordinary American does have a role in the country and that they're NOT just a bunch of hillbillies and deplorables.   I'd like to see that same attitude come to Canada.   We're all important,  not just the corporate elites.

text:
Oh...Oh...Got this:  Difference between the US & China.  US - since I believe the early 70's, President signed a high tax on year end inventory.  Companies, especially high tech, could no longer hog up production of semiconductors...huge shortages...a lot of waste.  Over the years...it became known as "Just In Time" ordering. by the time 2008 rolls around companies ordered parts from China, on a rolling forecast, and ordered exactly what they needed that week for production.
China - delivering to the world market in huge volumes - millions verses, 10K in US for one company.  In order to do this, they need plans up to 5-years in advance to build and open a new factories to support such high volume.  For instance, first generation LCD panels were only about  12"x16" to 5th gen of 9.6ft x 11ft.  Therefore China has a very high "mass" in the supply chain - just for these panels they need many materials from other manufacturers.  There is a huge huge investment to order these materials and must be ordered way in advance - average about 1 -year.
author: HangGlideTube

text: Therefore China cannot simply turn off the spigot - might take them a year or two - and will lose 100s of millions of dollars - close down factories not yet built....close down factories currently operating....huge inventory of parts that are still in the supply chain - those companies need to shut down...rinse repeat all up and down the supply chain.  Meanwhile, the US can turn all of this off practically overnight.

text:
Indeed.  It's classic Saul Alinsky Rules for Radicals, #RULE 12: "Pick the target, freeze it, personalize it, and polarize it.”  This follow-on description of this particular Rule comes from another website (originally from Glenn Beck):


*  Cut off the support network and isolate the target from sympathy. Go after people and not institutions; people hurt faster than institutions. (This is cruel, but very effective. Direct, personalized criticism and ridicule works.)


Trouble is, China's leadership is steeped in communism.  Alinsky's "Rules" are for socialism.  Thus, they are rookies in using such tactics, unpolished.  They look buffoonish.  Against a classic US political figure (of either party)?... sure, this tactic might work, as most politicians have the spine of a wet noodle.  


But not Donald Trump, nor Steve Bannon.  Both men possess a blue collar mentality (yes, even Trump with his millionaire father, who btw forced young Donald to do yeoman's work as a young man to gain a respect for such work).  With such a background,  I suspect the two clashed in the White House, BUT I think both men have the same vision.  What's more, they've both had it for a long time. In fact, Trump has been offering hints towards this for 40 years now.  To wit, go back and look at his interview with Rona Barrett in 1980 where she innocently yet extemporaneously asked Donald, "You sound like you might run for President.  Will you?"  He responded earnestly (paraphrasing), "No, I think there are other people better suited for that job. BUT I JUST DON'T LIKE WHAT'S HAPPENING IN OUR COUNTRY."  Trump repeated this message over the next 15-20 years in several other celebrity interviews, including no less than with Oprah Winfrey herself.  Plus, by the time he got to the Oprah interview he added a kicker statement: "BUT IF IT GOT BAD ENOUGH, THEN YES, I WOULD RUN FOR POTUS.  WHAT'S MORE, I THINK I'D HAVE A GOOD SHOT AT WINNING."  


Well, it got bad enough, and Trump was true to his word, especially on the "winning" part.  Bannon, having served both as a US Naval officer in hotly contested areas of the globe AND as an investment banker, had the opportunity to observe global things from a rather unique, inside perspective:  from the "boots on the ground" viewpoint to the financing of things that, ahem, all seemed to route back to China. 


So, good luck to the Chinese communist - or totalitarian mercantilist, as Steve calls it - leaders if they want to fight Steve Bannon.  He's more than up to the task.  He knows their "game" and he's calling them out on it.  The MAGA movement is not just about Trump or America; look what's happening in Europe with Brexit in Great Britain.  Plus, consider the Yellow Vests in France.  Look at the Russian manipulations in Austria just this week.  Reform is afoot globally, and it's all pushing back against China and it's (greedy) manipulations.  And that's where Steve Bannon is, right in the thick of it, a beacon of clarity in the booms and rumbles of an economic war.  What's more, I think he's able to help Trump more from the outside than from inside the White House.  He's not constrained by governmental etiquette and protocol rules.  He can free-wheel as he pleases.  


Make no mistake: Trump and Bannon are both on the same side.  And together, they provide a one-two punch that the Chinese never saw coming.  As the Southern phrase says:  This is fixin'ta get good! ;)

author: Troy Ezell

text: @Troy Ezell then Trump and I must have something in common because he is running a big fat zero on his deals as well.
author: Jeffrey Miller

text:
Jeffrey Miller no no no, no he is not. I said you did not understand negotiations and I was right. Because someone does not agree to a collaboration does NOT mean you lost the deal. A deal is not what two parties agree to, it is the ultimate outcome intended by the one who originally negotiated the deal. The two parties no doubt are beneficiaries but that does not constitute the deal. 

Trump is not after two parties getting along, he is after the idea of the world not being able to run us over or get away with robbing us blind anymore. In other words Trump wants to put a stop to what China and a plethora of other countries have been doing, taking advantage of US and stealing our technologies all while demonizing US at the same time. Trump’s ultimate goal is to level the playing field again and he is right on track to accomplish that goal. 

To your point regarding the tariffs hurting us as much as it is China, you are incorrect, in fact not even close. China is so intertwined with our economy, that they are like a giant  leach that threatens to suck the life out of its host if it doesn’t stop giving it trouble, forgetting however that it cannot survive whiteout it’s host in the first place. Trump wants the blood sucking to stop and true, equilateral trade to take place.
author: Troy Ezell

text:
@Troy Ezell Not true. Our exchange with China has become symbiotic. Pretty much every trinket and gadget is made in China now. Go look through your house, throw out everything that says "made in china" on it, and you will find you have very little left. China does business with everyone, not just the US. So, they can, and will, outlast Trump. 

And you are right about dealmaking, but that isnt what trump is doing. Yes, other countries have taken advantage of us, but that's our tax for getting to be top dog and essentially running the world for the last 60 years. 2 1/2 years of Trump and what do we have to show for it? Him riding the coattails of Obama's economic recovery, cleaning up yet another economic disaster brought on by, you guessed it, Republican lack of oversight and accountability. And... and... oh yea, that's all he has done.
author: Jeffrey Miller

text:
Jeffrey Miller Symbiotic implies that we have to have a relationship with China or we fall apart. If that were the case then we should have fallen apart when we left Japan and Taiwan as our primary means of manufacturing, but we did not. Though that is a great way of looking at our relationship with China, but it doesn’t adequately explain the true nature. China is stealing everything they can and taking over numerous ports around the world by creating debt crisis with smaller countries. China is not a partner, it is a predator bent on domination, and destruction if necessary. We simply cannot trust China. While at the same time, we have the means of manufacturing our own goods and dealing with other countries. In fact, the  more remove unnecessary regulations the more cost effective our manufacturing will become. We need don’t need China, we need trustworthy trade partners and to reestablish as much of our own manufacturing as we can. If China doesn’t want to work with us, then we can move on. 

To your other point, lol, yes Trump is working towards the long term, with the entire world, not just China.

Lastly, and it’s all I can do to keep from laughing, there was no “economic recovery” under Obama. Obama himself stated that the past days of good paying manufacturing jobs was behind us and we were not going to get it back. He poured more money than Bush into the economy and spent twice as much. After eight years our economy was still stagnant. Quit rewriting history for Obama and your own conscious. None of the current recovery had anything to do with Obama. Trump has brought back a lot more manufacturing than what has been publicized. Returning manufacturing back to our country however will require a lot more work due to the regulatory obstacles we have created. It’s coming though. By the way, quit accepting the stealing as “a tax” we have to pay.
author: Troy Ezell

1)The Chinese HATE independence. They are imperialistic and have EVERY intention of taking over. They LOVE the idea of a NWO and intend to be on top of that power structure.

2) The Chinese have been STEALING from OUR innovators for YEARS. Why? Because there is LITTLE incentive to invent ANYTHING if the government gets the credit and the profit for YOUR work.
